title: Weekly snapshot of Chinese culture news
content:
BEIJING, Dec. 14 (Xinhua) -- The following are the highlights of China's key culture news from the past week:
-- China to improve identification, management of intangible cultural heritage inheritors
China's Ministry of Culture and Tourism released a regulation Tuesday on improving the identification and management of representative inheritors of national-level intangible cultural heritage (ICH).
The regulation details the criteria for identifying representative inheritors, including their skills, representativeness, social influence and moral standing.
-- China supports international Chinese language education programs: vice premier
The Chinese government provides support to the public from various countries in learning the Chinese language, Vice Premier Sun Chunlan said Monday.
Sun, also a member of the Political Bureau of the Communist Party of China Central Committee, delivered a keynote speech at the International Chinese Language Education Conference that opened in Changsha, capital of central China's Hunan Province.
-- International seminar on interfaith exchanges held in Beijing
An international seminar on interfaith exchanges and the building of a community of a shared future for humanity was held Wednesday in Beijing.
Representatives discussed topics including religion and ecological civilization, cultural values of religion, and religion and social harmony, sharing the philosophies and practices of different countries and religions in tackling global challenges. Enditem
